src:
FOTO: Avtomobili namesto klobas in cvička
Pred 60 leti sta se Agroservis in Motomontaža združila v IMV. Pri Novem mestu muzejska zbirka o razvoju avtomobilske in prikoličarske proizvodnje na Dolenjskem.
07 Nov 2019, 09:03 by Primož Hieng



V IMV so nastajale priljubljene katrce. FOTO: Arhiv družine Gombač



Adrijine prikolice so bile zelo različne, saj so izdelali 37 tipov. FOTO: Arhiv družine Gombač



Martin Sever (levo) je bil oče IMV-jevega kombija. FOTO: Arhiv družine Gombač



Prve prikolice je oblikoval Martin Sever. FOTO: Klub IMV



Bogata zbirka osebnih vozil FOTO: Klub IMV



Kombiji v novomeški zbirki FOTO: Klub IMV


NOVO MESTO – Zgodba o velikanu pod Gorjanci, nekdanji Industriji motornih vozil IMV Novo mesto, je zagotovo ena najbolj odmevnih in prepoznavnih, saj kaže vso zagnanost, pogum in odločnost ljudi, da bi presegli uradno zapovedane okvire. Te je Dolenjski namenila tedanja oblast, ki je menila, naj ti kraji še naprej pridelujejo predvsem cviček, kranjske klobase in zelje.Tako pravijo v Klubu prijateljev IMV in dodajajo, da se je zgodilo nekaj povsem drugega: »Namesto izrazite usmerjenosti v kmetijstvo je tu nastala avtomobilska industrija, ki spada v sam svetovni vrh, saj je današnji Revoz poleg Adrie Mobil, TPV in drugih eden od naslednikov nekdanjega IMV.«
Postavili so mu spomenik
»Dolenjska naj bo rezervat za klobase, kislo zelje in medvede …« so odločili povojni oblastniki in že tako nerazvito južno Slovenijo od Save do kočevskih gozdov, od Kolpe do višnjegorskih hribov prepustili podeželskemu životarjenju.Tako je leta 2009 v uvodnem poglavju v knjigi Povest o velikanu pod Gorjanci zapisal Marjan Ivan Moškon. Toda kljub tem, za današnji čas zelo nenavadnim načrtom se je vse skupaj odvilo povsem drugače. Po zaslugi izjemne volje, drznih zamisli in poguma Podgurcev, kot pravijo prebivalcem tega območja, so začeli nastajati temelji avtomobilske industrije, bolj znane pod imenom IMV – Industrija motornih vozil Novo mesto.Nekdanji že upokojeni delavci podjetja Industrija motornih vozil (IMV) so prepoznali potrebo po pomembnosti in ohranjanju spomina na industrijsko kulturno dediščino IMV v slovenskem prostoru in širše. Na teh temeljih so v letu 2002 ustanovili Klub prijateljev IMV.»Prvi odmevni projekt kluba je bila uresničitev ideje o ohranitvi zgodovine IMV, ki bo še desetletja učila in opominjala, v kakšnih razmerah sta nastajala prvi domači dostavni avtomobil in prikolica Adria,« pravijo v Klubu prijateljev IMV. »Ob 50-letnici ustanovitve Industrije motornih vozil je tako nastala ugledna in razkošna monografija Povest o velikanu pod Gorjanci. Pri tem je bilo treba zbrati gradivo pri nekaj sto darovalcih slikovnega materiala ter priklicati v spomin dogodke in številke za več desetletij nazaj, sicer si avtor ne bi mogel pomagati z muzejskimi materiali in časopisnimi izrezki. Z monografijo je nastal sistematiziran arhiv zgodovinskih posnetkov, ki mu je tudi Tehniški muzej Slovenije izrekel priznanje,« dodajajo.Klubu je v preteklih letih uspelo zabeležiti zgodovino IMV tudi v dveh zanimivih dokumentarnih videih, ki sta izdelana po tej monografiji, omenita tudi njene snovalce ter predstavita gospodarstvenika Jurija Levičnika. Slednjemu so postavili spomenik, s podporo Mestne občine Novo mesto pa jim je po tem novomeškem avtomobilskem vizionarju uspelo poimenovati še cesto.
Sestavljali tudi austine
»Klub je bil v letu 2008 pobudnik za ustanovitev in postavitev muzejske zbirke o razvoju avtomobilske in prikoličarske proizvodnje na Dolenjskem,« pojasnijo njegovi sodelavci in dodajajo: »Rezultat zaveze je bil potrjen leta 2010. Danes se ta zbirka ponaša z izjemnimi eksponati – tako imamo 40 avtomobilov in prikolic ter namensko urejen poseben prostor z izdelki in dokumentacijo za izobraževalne namene. Muzejska zbirka je v Drgančevju pri Novem mestu.«Podjetje za proizvodnjo osebnih in dostavnih vozil, počitniških prikolic ter sestavnih delov za motorna vozila IMV Novo mesto je nastalo iz podjetij Agroservis (1945) in Motomontaža (1955), ki sta med drugim kot kooperanta sestavljala osebna in dostavna vozila za nemško družbo Auto Union (danes Audi). Podjetji sta se združili leta 1959 in preimenovali v Industrijo motornih vozil Novo mesto (IMV).Tovarna je licenčno izdelovala predvsem kombinirana vozila DKW Schnellaster. Med letoma 1967 in 1972 so v IMV v sodelovanju z British Leyland Motor Company licenčno sestavljali osebne avtomobile znamke Austin.
Z Mercedesovim motorjem
Plod lastnega razvoja so bila kombinirana vozila, ki so jih kmalu izdelovali v 15 različicah s prilagojeno namembnostjo. Model IMV 1000 je imel motor proizvajalca DKW s prostornino 981 kubičnih centimetrov. Model IMV 1600R je imel Renaultov motor s prostornino 1647 kubičnih centimetrov, izdelovali pa so tudi model IMV 2200D, ki je imel motor tovarne Mercedes-Benz s prostornino 2197 kubičnih centimetrov.IMV je v svojem uspešnem obdobju sodeloval tudi z Litostrojem, saj je od te ljubljanske tovarne prevzel kooperacijsko pogodbo. V tovarni v Novem mestu so od leta 1973 sprva sestavljali, nato pa izdelovali osebna vozila znamke Renault, in sicer modele renault 4, 5, 12, 18 in renault clio. Od leta 1989 je podjetje v večinski lasti francoskega koncerna Renault, zato so leta 1992 opustili naziv gospodarske družbe in logotip IMV. Družba se odtlej imenuje Revoz in je edini proizvajalec avtomobilov v Sloveniji. Pomemben je bil tudi razvoj počitniških prikolic in avtodomov, ki so jih prodajali pod blagovno znamko Adria. Enota počitniških prikolic in avtodomov IMV je z letom 1995 prevzela ime Adria Mobil in postala samostojna gospodarska družba.
text:
PHOTO: Cars Instead of Sausages and Cucumbers
60 years ago Agroservis and Motomontaža merged into IMV. At Novo mesto, a museum collection on the development of car and trailer production in Dolenjska.
07 Nov 2019, 09:03 by Primoz Hieng



Popular katras were made at IMV. PHOTO: Gombac Family Archive



Adria's trailers were very different, producing 37 types. PHOTO: Gombac Family Archive



Martin Sever (left) was the father of IMV's van. PHOTO: Gombac Family Archive



The first trailers were designed by Martin Sever. PHOTO: IMV Club



A rich collection of passenger cars PHOTO: IMV Club



Vans in the Novo mesto Collection PHOTO: IMV Club


NOVO MESTO - The story of the giant under Gorjanci, formerly the IMV Novo mesto Motor Vehicle Industry, is certainly one of the most high-profile and recognizable, as it shows all the enthusiasm, courage and determination of people to go beyond the officially stated framework. Dolenjska was targeted by the authorities at the time, who believed that these places should continue to produce mainly Cviček, Carniolan sausages and cabbages. They say so at the IMV Friends Club, adding that something completely different happened: "Instead of a strong focus on agriculture, here The automotive industry emerged as one of the world's top companies, as today's Revoz is one of the successors of the former IMV alongside Adria Mobil, TPV and others. "
They erected a monument for him
"The Dolenjska region should be a reserve for sausages, sauerkraut and bears ..." was decided by the post-war rulers and the already underdeveloped southern Slovenia from the Sava to the Kočevje forests, from the Kolpa to the Alps hills. Marjan Ivan Moškon wrote the giant under Gorjanci. But despite these very unusual plans today, things have gone completely different. Thanks to the exceptional will, bold ideas and courage of the Podgurts, as the residents of the area say, the foundations of the automotive industry, better known as IMV - Motor Vehicle Industry Novo mesto, have begun to emerge. the importance and preservation of the memory of IMV's industrial cultural heritage in Slovenia and beyond. The IMV Friends Club was founded on these foundations in 2002. "The club's first high-profile project was the realization of the idea of preserving IMV history, which will teach and reminisce for decades under what conditions the first domestic delivery car and Adria trailer were created," they say in IMV Friends Club. »On the 50th anniversary of the founding of the Motor Vehicle Industry, the renowned and lavish monograph The Story of the Giant under Gorjanci was created. In doing so, it was necessary to collect material from several hundred donors of pictorial material and to recall events and figures from decades ago, otherwise the author could not help himself with museum materials and newspaper clippings. The monograph created a systematic archive of historical recordings, to which the Technical Museum of Slovenia also acknowledged, "they add. In the past, the club has managed to record the history of IMV in two interesting documentary videos produced under this monograph, mention its creators and introduce businessman Yuri Levichnik. A monument was erected to the latter, and with the support of the City of Novo mesto, they managed to name the road after this visionary automotive visionary.
They also composed austinas
"In 2008, the club initiated the establishment and installation of a museum collection on the development of car and trailer production in Dolenjska," his colleagues explain, adding: "The result of the commitment was confirmed in 2010. Today, this collection boasts exceptional exhibits - that's how we have it 40 cars and trailers and a purpose-built special space with products and documentation for educational purposes. The museum collection is in Drgančevje near Novo mesto. The company for the production of cars and vans, caravans and motor vehicle components IMV Novo mesto was created by Agroservis (1945) and Motomontaža (1955), which, among others, were subcontractors. passenger cars and vans for the German company Auto Union (today Audi). The two companies merged in 1959 and renamed the Novo mesto Motor Vehicle Industry (IMV). The plant is licensed primarily to produce DKW Schnellaster combined vehicles. Between 1967 and 1972, IMV, in partnership with the British Leyland Motor Company, licensed Austin-owned passenger cars.
With a Mercedes engine
The result of their own development were combined vehicles, which were soon produced in 15 custom-made variants. The IMV 1000 had a DKW engine of 981 cubic centimeters. The IMV 1600R had a Renault engine of 1647 cubic centimeters, and the IMV 2200D was built, which had a 2197 cubic-inch Mercedes-Benz engine. IMV also collaborated with Litostro in its successful period. factory in Ljubljana took over the cooperation contract. The factory in Novo mesto was initially assembled and manufactured from 1973 onwards by Renault vehicles, namely the Renault 4, 5, 12, 18 and Renault clio. Since 1989, the company has been majority owned by the French Renault Group, so in 1992 the company name and the IMV logo were dropped. The company has since been called Revoz and is the only car manufacturer in Slovenia. Also important was the development of caravans and motorhomes sold under the Adria brand. The caravans and motor homes unit IMV took over the name Adria Mobil in 1995 and became an independent company.
